one_reviews_text: Good history. Artfully done. Helps imagine what it was like. Would appreciate more context of the Socialist Anti-Imperialists vs the Capitalist Colonizers
Nice to sit and watch. Minimal imersion
This is a brilliant documentary that gets round the limitations of VR/BBC budgets through creating a fantastic audiovisual impressionist experience

I absoluetly love the way that VR is heading! What a great way to truely understand history but to actually be in it something that we could have only dreamed of just a few years ago. Although its's just a short little clip this experience lets you truely grasp and understand what was happening in this time from the eyes of a liberator. Fantastic experience

So this is not the best VR experience out there, but it does a good job of what it is supposed to do:  tell a story that gets you interested.  I do wish there had been more details.  But I understand there were probably limitations on what they could present given time and money constraints.  However, I did enjoy the way the presented this historical event.  It's VR done right.
If you like war history, you'll enjoy this. Surprised by the amount of detail conveyed. Nice art style.

A descriptive and non-biased telling of one mans personal experience during a very divisive event in history.  If you enjoy historical events, you will enjoy this.  Thank you to the Devs for taking the time and resources to create this.
I love the style of this demo and it's approach to storytelling is pretty engaging. I'd love more stories told in this style.

Good visuals, good transitions. Felt like it would have been better as a standing experience  and there were a few times I really would have liked to pick things up in the environment. But overall really enjoyable and a good use of VR

I thought the visual elements and naration were very well done. I enjoyed the archival footage, and how the story came to life. I liked some of the interactive elements, as well. 

Overall, I found the story to be a bit disjointed, and thought different parts could have been connected better. I also felt that some of the interactive elements could have been enhanced and expanded on.
An interesting and beautifully depicted, brief look at the Uprising - a very important moment in history.
THIS is how to do VR storytelling. informative and interesting, great production quality, perfect unification VR, documentaries and art.
While this was beautifully directed, and explores innovations in VR cinematography i found the story and directing a bit bland and boring.
